column5: Thinking of doing a September drive in trip. Looking for Pike, the bigger the better. Don't care if there are any Walleyes in the lake. Likely be coming alone would like a decent cabin. I can cook myself, don't really need a guide. Will be bringing my own boat. Will cross at International Falls Mn. In a perfect world no gravel roads. Open for idea's. Any camp owners can shoot me a PM if you have a opening. Again, I'm after Pike. Thank you.
Lac Seul has pike, but it's a lot of water to cover. We stay at Frog Rapids Camp and trailer to Lac Seul.
check out www.birchdalelodge.com on Eagle Lake, 807-227-5262 owners name is Marcell

Thank you, I have seen you post their web site many, many times over the years. This is the first time I ever opened the link and took a look. Very impressive clear to understand web site. It seems like a million years since I was last on Eagle. Are there a lot of rock hazards and are they well marked? I understand going slow but was curious what you can tell me.

http://vermilionbaylodge.com/Check out V-Bay Lodge. Great place with really nice cabins at a great price. Gord has his infamous Musky Madness week going on 9/22-9/29 which may fit into your schedule. There will be a lot of folks in camp specifically fishing for big fish.I can suggest some spots we have fished ( more summer pattern), but there are some monsters in the lake. Of course, Gord has guided on this lake for many many years so he knows better than anyone where the big fish might be in September.The lake is very easy to navigate , in my opinion, with hazards marked fairly well. HotSpots map has pretty good detail on the hazards as well.PjShorthorn

Don't listen to those guys, www.templebay.com, is where you want to go on Eagle. To be honest, it seems like the pike numbers and size are down in recent years but I never actually target them. It could be a 40+ every time I get bit off while jigging.
Don't over look Wabigoon Lake, plus you are minutes away from town from all the lodges on it.

You might consider Jim's Caviar Camp. East of Sioux Narrows. Drive to landing / boat to lodge. Big Northern and Muskies in Caviar. No Walleye to speak of. (portage for Walleye) Good smallies too.https://jimscaviarcamp.com/
